review.body: Just ok

This was a quick read, left you feeling warm & fuzzy. It is the second in this series (I did not read the first) but it was easily read as a stand alone.

ARC provided by the publisher via Netgalley in exchange for an honest review.

book.title: Snappsy the Alligator (Did Not Ask to Be in This Book)

review.body: Terrific mentor text for breaking the fourth wall. Gives students options in creative writing.
Light...Childish and chill !!

book.title: Spinster: Making a Life of One's Own

review.body: Listening to on Scribd. Narrated by Kate Bolick

Right from the beginning I was hooked. The description and dialogue trapped me within the pages of the story. Erik Sinclair is a cocky, arrogant jerk, which came through perfectly in the beginning. Throughout the story you see behind the mask of a star and let us see who he really is. Ronnie (the...

book.title: Sweets & Treats with Six Sisters' Stuff: 100+ Desserts, Gift Ideas, and Traditions for the Whole Family

review.body:
There are so many amazing, easy recipes in here - I think I gained weight just reading the book! These girls really know how to add easy panache to celebrations. The highlights for me were a few of the bar recipes and the banoffee pie.

There's no nutritional information (which may be a good thing)...

book.title: My History: A Memoir of Growing Up

review.body: This is not fiction, but her world is so completely different to mine it might as well be fiction. It did not engage me in the way that a good novel would - I am just not interested enough in who she is and what she has done, admirable although her writing achievements undoubtedly are.
I hated it.

Very good read.

Nice book called t wait for the next one to come out the purple and black Dragon shoe be lyrics .
This is by far the best book I have ever read. If you dont cry during this book you need to see a doctor.
Great read, could not put it down.

book.title: The Bennett Case (A Markham Sisters Cozy Mystery, #2)

review.body:
Interesting

The storyline was different from any mystery books I've read, I did find it interesting. The characters were a different group from what I have encountered before; sometimes funny.

Sebenarnya ceritanya mulai lebih berisi, tapi banyak pengulangan info yang berlebihan, di setiap bab mengulang hal yang sama. Dan editing juga terjemahannya bisa lebih halus. Banyak dialog yang ejaannya salah dan terlalu banyak pakai tanda seru jadi kesannya setiap bicara karakternya sedang berse...

I really liked this book. The characters were so normal and relatable. You have Ember, a girl that is going through life and trying to figure out how to live after a tragedy. Then you have Vance, a guy trying to deal with a tragedy and a very uncertain future. I liked that there was not an instal...
Great little nostalgic novella. I had a lot of good laughs reading this book, and it brought up many childhood memories.

A graphic novel that interweaves a fairy-cautionary tale about changing what should be with a hopes and aspirations of a determined, take-charge-with-no-apologies, bossy chef. House spirits, posh menus, and uber cute waitstaff included. A super fun, delicious, creative tale.

Re-read this childhood favorite, and it's still good. He does an excellent job of portraying precocious children and Ender's moral struggles. The school dynamics are so vivid, as are all the games and simulations. A science fiction classic!

book.title: Bitter of Tongue (Tales from the Shadowhunter Academy, #7)

review.body:
4.5

my heart. it's breaking.

book.title: My Bloody Life: The Making of a Latin King

review.body: Reymundo Sanchez is looking to escape child abuse from his mom and step dad, so he turns from baseball and school to sex, alcohol, and drugs by joining one of the most feared gang in Chicago the Latin Kings. Reymundo Sanchez is about 14 years old and he is already smoking, drinking, and having se...
